item.title: Ticket #590 (get_category_link() needs to be updated) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #590 (get_category_link() needs to be updated) created
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
get_category_link() (template-functions-category.php, line 27) takes too many parameters and often doesn't work. Attached is a file containing the old function and my ammendments.

Updates I've made:

  • No longer relies on $cache_categories being used
  • Fixed tabs
  • Removed redundant parameters/variables/global variables

item.title: Ticket #589 (add_option caches serialized values) updated
item.dc:creator: ColdForged
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #589 (add_option caches serialized values) created
item.dc:creator: ColdForged
item.description: The add_option() function caches the serialized version of the option values and is the only path in the code that does so. Therefore, pages that add an option and then get_option() on that option will retrieve the serialized string in response, whereas later invocations (when not cached or when autoloaded) will retrieve the unserialized Array or object. Having to code for both possibilities is onerous.

item.title: Ticket #367 (Feeds do not include language information) updated
item.dc:creator: Stedi
item.description: There is an active discussion going on about WordPress and the lack of it's support for language setting at syndic8.com newsgroup. As a one of the feed reviewers, I really agree that it is very annoying that the language settings are missing from the feeds, I really would have liked it to be fixed in 1.2.2. So many feeds can not be approved just because of the missing language setting. What a pity.

item.title: Ticket #588 (Single Quotemarks used in Link (href) properties breaks validation) updated
item.dc:creator: solvingnormal
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #588 (Single Quotemarks used in Link (href) properties breaks validation) created
item.dc:creator: solvingnormal
item.description:
It seems that sometime between 1.3a3 and the current nightly something changed in the way that user-entered links and links for archive pages are turned into HTML. It causes pages to no longer validate.

Previously, they were as such: <a href="​http://wordpress.org/" title="Powered by WordPress"> <img src="​http://www.solvingnormal.com/images/wp.gif" alt="WordPress" title="Powered by WordPress" /></a>

Now, they have single quotemarks: <a href='​http://wordpress.org/' title='Powered by WordPress'> <img src='​http://www.solvingnormal.com/images/wp.gif' alt='WordPress' title='Powered by WordPress' /></a>

The problem arises when the title or alt text has an apostrophe/single quote mark in it, because it's seen as the closing mark for the tag property and the validator gives errors.

(Example of problem tag: <a ... title='Justin's LiveJournal'>)

If I can clarify this at all, please let me know. Or if this is meant to be this way for a reason, and there's something I should be doing differently, let me know that too.

(The href tags for the archive page links have been changed to single quotemarks as well)

item.title: Ticket #578 (Links cannot be edited) updated
item.dc:creator: deadscan
item.description:
I found out, that i can ADD and DELETE new links. But I still cannot EDIT them (even the new added links).

I deleted all files from 1.2.1 and installed the files from 1.2.2 -> always the same problem with my database. the only solution is to use the file link-manager.php from 1.2.1

item.title: Ticket #587 (Comments RSS shows latest entry url as itemlink for all items) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I have rolled back to a 2004-15-12 nightly, this appears to have fixed the problem. As such, it seems the repeating post URL is related to changes in the 2004-12-16 nightly.

Edit: Forgot to log in. This is Joen commenting.

edited on: 12-23-04 13:44

item.title: Ticket #587 (Comments RSS shows latest entry url as itemlink for all items) updated
item.dc:creator: Joen
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #587 (Comments RSS shows latest entry url as itemlink for all items) created
item.dc:creator: Joen
item.description:
This issue doesn't seem to affect 1.2.2, only the latest nightlies.

I have tried varous older nightlies, though none older than 2004-12-10. They all seem to sport the same problem.

Here's an example of the borked feed: ​http://www.noscope.com/journal/comments/feed/rss2/

Here's an example of the 1.2.2 feed that works: ​http://www.noscope.com/beta/wp-commentsrss2.php

item.title: Ticket #586 (PHP Notice in wp-admin/setup-config.php) created
item.dc:creator: joseph
item.description:
During the install for WP 1.2.2 the following notice is made:

Notice: Undefined index: step in /Users/joseph/Sites/wordpress/wp-admin/setup-config.php on line 13

I've attached a simple diff to fix this.

item.title: Changeset [1995]: Use SCRIPT_FILENAME instead of PATH_TRANSLATED since PATH_TRANSLATED ...
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Use SCRIPT_FILENAME instead of PATH_TRANSLATED since PATH_TRANSLATED is not always set. Consolidate home path logic into get_home_path().
